item.title: Rachel add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "The possession of knowledge does not kill the sense of wonder and mystery. There is always more mystery." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
item.description: "We should consider every day lost on which we have not danced at least once." -- Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Pema Chödrön
item.description: "To be fully alive, fully human, and completely awake is to be continually thrown out of the nest. To live fully is to be always in no-man's-land, to experience each moment as completely new and fresh. To live is to be willing to die over and over again. " -- Pema Chödrön

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Beauty is only the start of bearable terror." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Rachel add a quote by André Gide
item.description: "One does not discover new lands without consenting to lose sight of the shore for a very long time." -- André Gide

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Michel Foucault
item.description: "I don't feel that it is necessary to know exactly what I am. The main interest in life and work is to become someone else that you were not in the beginning." -- Michel Foucault

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Michel Foucault
item.description: "It is meaningless to speak in the name of - or against - Reason, Truth, or Knowledge." -- Michel Foucault
